titleStmt.title: Tarltons jests Drawne into these three parts. 1 His court-witty iests. 2 His sound city iests. 3 His countrey pretty iests. Full of delight, wit, and honest mirth.
titleStmt.author: Tarlton, Richard, d. 1588, attributed name.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by I[ohn] H[aviland] for Andrew Crook, and are to be sold in Pauls Church-yard, at the signe of the Beare,

notesStmt.note: "More or less fictitious anecdotes, many of them far older than Tarlton, who probably was in no way responsible for the work"--Folger Shakespeare Library catalogue.
The words "1 His court-witty iests. .. 3 His countrey pretty iests." are bracketed together on the title page.
In this edition, C2r lines 4,5 from bottom read: "Globe on the #5FD\ Banks side".
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.

place.placeName: Pauls Church-yard, at the signe of the Beare
